pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:0.2: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:0.5: 4. The training rule on asking for something else
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.1: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.3: A lay follower went to her and asked,
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.4: “Venerable, what’s wrong with you? What may I get you?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.6: That lay follower then brought back from a shop a _kahāpaṇa_’s worth of ghee and gave it to Thullanandā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.10: The lay follower returned to the shopkeeper and said,
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.11: “It seems the nun doesn’t need ghee, but oil.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.12: Here’s your ghee; please give me oil.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.13: “Sir, if we were to take back goods that have been sold, when would our goods be sold?
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.14: When ghee is bought, ghee is taken away. Buying oil, you receive that, and you’ll take that away.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.15: That lay follower then complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.16: “How could Venerable Thullanandā ask for one thing and then for something else?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.17: The nuns heard the complaints of that lay follower,
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.18: and the nuns of few desires complained and criticized her …
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.19: Those nuns then told the monks,
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.20: who in turn told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.21: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā did this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.24: “How could the nun Thullanandā ask for one thing and then for something else?
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.26: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.27.1: ‘If a nun asks for one thing and then for something else, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:2.1.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:2.1.8: apart from that thing, if she asks for something else, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:2.1.9: When she gets it, it becomes subject to relinquishment.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:2.1.10: It is to be relinquished to a sangha, a group, or an individual nun.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:2.1.11: “And, monks, it’s to be relinquished like this.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:2.1.12: (To be expanded as in Nuns’ Relinquishment 1, [](pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.21--2.1.43), with appropriate substitutions.)
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:2.1.13: … ‘Venerables, this thing, which I asked for after asking for something else, is to be relinquished. I relinquish it to the Sangha.’ …
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:2.2.1: If it is something else and she perceives it as such, and she asks for that, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:2.2.2: If it is something else, but she is unsure of it, and she asks for that, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:2.2.3: If it is something else, but she does not perceive it as such, and she asks for that, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:2.2.4: If it is not something else, but she perceives it as such, and she asks for that, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:2.2.5: If it is not something else, but she is unsure of it, and she asks for that, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:2.2.6: If it is not something else, and she does not perceive it as such, and she asks for that, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:2.3.2: if she asks for both at the same time;
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:2.3.3: if she can show a benefit in asking;
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:2.3.5: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:2.3.6: The fourth training rule is finished.
